"La síntesis de la pasada elección en elEstado de México quedó plasmada en una imagen:decenas de cabezas de cerdo afuera de las casas de campañadel rival. Así se ejerce la política en una de laszonas más violentas del país, donde el GrupoAtlacomulco hizo alarde de recursos económicos yprácticas clientelares para perpetuarse en el poder. Y esaquí, en territorio mexiquense, donde los habitantes se hanresignado a vivir en la inseguridad, a jugársela entraslados diarios de tres horas a sus centros de trabajo mientrassus funcionarios despachan desde las alturas en imponenteshelicópteros. Quien diga que la frontera interior enMéxico es la que divide a la riqueza de la pobreza, no hareparado en este lugar, donde la verdadera zanja separa agobernantes y gobernados. En este contexto, el periodista Humberto Padgett presenta una investigación que retrata las condiciones de desigualdad social, inseguridad,corrupción, narcotráfico y secuestro en la entidad. Su trabajo permite entender cómo los nexos con el crimen organizado han permitido a una clase políticainsensible y a sus huestes burocráticas, amasar fortunas y feudos de impunidad en un modelo que se extiende, lamentablemente, a todos los rincones del país."--Back cover.

"El año pinta mal; hay presagios funestos lo mismo en el cielo que en las suertes echadas con maízpinto. Algo grave ha de ocurrir en el reino de la Nueva España. Juana Inés y Diego, como parte del brazo juvenil de la secreta Sociedad de losHerméticos, reciben el encargo de ciencia ficción,reo de la Santa Inquisición; este asunto, por azares del destino, los conecta con una hermosa mulata, hechicera ella, y un chamán indio que tiene como nahual a un guajolote justiciero, para enfrentar juntos un reto que parece imposible: cambiar el futuro que ya está escrito y con ello impedir una enorme tragedia. La Sociedad de los Herméticos con su brazo juvenil regresa luego de su emocionante aparición en Mascarada, publicada en 2003." --
Fondo Regional para la Cultura y las Artes del Noreste (Mexico),
La expedición fallida de Xavier Mina /
Estudios de caso para poner en valor el patrimonio cultural :

Introduccíon -- 1. Los valores cambiantes del patrimonio cultural y sutransformacíon en un recurso para el desarrollo sustentable --¡Qúe es el patrimonio cultural? --Los valores sociales del patrimonio cultural -- El valor económico del patrimonio cultural -- 2. El diagnóstico del patrimonio cultural de Numarán -- Apuntes metodológicos sobre la gestíon del patrimonio y la importancia del diagnóstico --El caso de Numarán -- Actores e intereses que confluyen en el patrimonio cultural de Numarán -- Gobierno municipal -- Actores sociales -- Otros actores -- La sociedad y el patrimonio cultural de Numarán -- Perfil de los encuestados -- La percepcíon social del espacio -- Los conceptos de patrimonio cultural y patrimonio natural -- Los bienes patrimoniales desde la perspectiva de los numarenses -- Tendencias en la gestíon del patrimonio cultural y expectativas sobre su divulgacíon -- 3. Inventario del patrimonio cultural de Numarán -- Patrimonio arqueológico -- Patrimonio histórico -- La parroquia de Santo Santiago -- Arquitectura vernácula -- Patrimonio inmaterial -- El diagnóstico y la importancia del consenso social para seguir adelante -- 4. Pénjamo y la comunicacíon del patrimonio cultural -- El diagnóstico del patrimonio cultural de Pénjamo -- El patrimonio cultural de Pénjamo y su relacíon conla sociedad -- Actores e intereses que confluyen en el patrimonio cultural de Pénjamo -- 5. Estrategias museográficas para dar a conocer el patrimonio -- Puntos de partida para la creacíon de un museo -- La nueva museología -- ¡Cómo hacer un museo comunitario? -- Estrategias de planeacíon museográfica para el caso de Pénjamo ¡Cómo crear un proyecto de museo y una exhibicíon? -- Proyecto ejecutivo inicial -- Centro Interpretativo de Pénjamo -- Cuando el museo se transforma en un recurso turístico -- Conclusiones.

"This text presents two cases and the resulting problems when local governments, despite integrating the perspective of sustainable development into their plans and projects, applied a management model of patrimonyconservation. Their methods were incomplete when they favor tourism development without considering that local patrimony and other cultural values, conditioning risks for their conservation and exclusion from society. The reader will find in this text tools to manage the heritage, based on their knowledge or diagnosis, presented from the case of Numarán, which results in an inventory that will be the basis for proposing strategies to put it into value through its communication, which should be developed in the case of Pénjamo" (HKB Translation) --Verso cover.
Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, Centro Regional de InvestigacionesMultidisciplinarias,

This work is a first exploration of green crime in Mexicothat offers a unique critique of current environmental problems.Written by a wide range of scholars and professionals from variousdisciplines, this work exposes corruption, power and lack ofrespect for the environment through detailed and suggestive casestudies. The chapters are grouped into four categories:environmental degradation, social and environmental justice,wildlife trade and non-compliance with environmental obligations,exposed in the light of rigorous original research. This book fillsa substantial gap in knowledge about concerns that are importantnot only for Mexicans, but for anyone interested in theenvironmental problems of today's world. The authors wish toinspire other academics and professionals to study and investigate ecological crimes in Mexico as well as in Central and South America, as they are regions facing similar crises and environmental challenges.
Bibliography at the end of each chapter.

Exposes problems of crimes against environment thatreveal corruption, abuse of power and disdain for nature in variousdetailed case studies. Chapters are grouped into four categories:environmental damage, social and environmental justice, traffickingin wildlife, and environmental legislation. Papers are written byscholars from several academic disciplines. Edition limited to 200copies.

Monography on figurative sculptor Agustín Cárdenas (b. Cuba 1927-2001). The collection conceived as an approach to the work of Cuban plastic artists offers a concentrated information that includes reviews and essays, images of his works, photographs and a biographical selection of the creator.
Consejo Nacional de las Artes Plásticas (Cuba),
Colección Espiral (Escuela Nacional de Artes Plásticas (Cuba)) ;
dirección editorial Isabel María Pérez Pérez ; [textos de] Marina Rodríguez and others].

Monography dedicated to graphic designer and artist Alfredo González Rostgaard (Cuba 1943-2004), one of the leading designers of revolutionary Cuban film and political posters through his work for the Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industria Cinematográficos (ICAIC). In the 1980's, he ventured in the use of papier-mâché to create toys for adults, (trains, planes, kites, butterflies, cars and other items), which in addition to their decorative value, provide a communicative and utilitarian function because some were used to keep envelopes and pens. The collection was conceived as an approach to the work of Cuban plastic artists offers a concentrated information that includes reviews and essays, images of his works, photographs and a biographical selection of the creator. The collection conceived as an approach to the work of Cuban plastic artists offers a concentrated information that includes reviews and essays, images of his works, photos and a biographical selection of the creator.
Consejo Nacional de las Artes Plásticas (Cuba),

The edition is a tribute to architect Enrique Cervantes Sánchez (Mexico 1923), for his invaluable contribution in the urban planning and conservation of historical monuments of Mexico for the last 60 years. Architect Cervantes throughout his career worked in the recovery of cities and their architectural, urban and cultural heritage in situations of catastrophes or natural disasters. He introduced zoning to urban planning and land use regulation, and elaborated land-use planning plans mainly used in Mexico City, and in Manzanillo, Tijuana, Uruapan, Saltillo, Acapulco and Zacapu, as well as in San Pedro Sula, Honduras and many cities more.

Bermúdez -- Como trabajan los artistas / Enrique Labrador Ruiz -- Crónicas del XI Salón de Bellas Artes: García Cabrera / Rafael Suárez Solís -- Enrique García Cabrera / Jorge Mañach -- García Cabrera / Ramón Vasconcelos -- García Cabrera / Ángel Lázaro -- Conmemoración / Jorge Mañach -- Cronología.

Enrique García Cabrera (Cuba 1893-1949) is considered one of the pioneers of Cuban graphic design of the 20th century. One hundred years later, this anthology rescues his elaborate Cuban Art Deco illustrations, an artistic legacy somehow ignored for more than 5 decades. "The Foundation opens with Enrique García Cabral, a series dedicated to the pioneers of graphic art. The zeal with which his descendants have preserved the legacy of Enrique García Cabral enables us to present this splendid book today." --Page 165.
Museo del Palacio de Bellas Artes
Secretaría de Cultura, Instituto Nacional de Bellas Artes,
Published on the occasion of the exhibition held June 14 to September 8, 2019 at the Museu del Palacio de Bellas Artes, in Mexico City.

Rebelión silenciosa / José Manuel Springer -- El arte es una mentira que dice la verdad: bitácora / Carla Stellweg -- De regreso al diablo: Francisco Icaza / Victor Manuel Mendiola -- Francisco Icaza: me quiero ir al mar / Santiago Espinoza de los Monteros, Natalia Gama Pourdanay -- Obra -- Cronología -- Lista catalográfica.

The recent exhibition of the painter Francisco Icaza (El Salvador, 1930 Mexico, 2014) brought together works of different techniques and periods for the first time. The exhibition curated by Santiago Espinosa de los Monteros and Natalie Gama Pourdanay, had a total of 145 works, that represent a selection in the production of Francisco Icaza's artisitc career, including unknown or very little exposed pieces. The publication that accompanies the exhibition includes critical texts and is complemented by a chronology that highlights the most important events in the painter's life; all this, illustrated with the works that were presented in the exhibition.
Museo del Palacio de Bellas Artes (Mexico),
[Javier Roque Vázquez Juárez, cuidado de la edición].
Secretaría de Cultura, Instituto Nacional de Bellas Artes,

"La exposición organizada por la Coordinación Nacional de Artes Visuales del INBA, se presenta en el Museo Rubén Herrera y el Centro Cultural Teatro Garcia Carrillo, posteriormente se exhibirá en el Museo Regional de la Laguna, tambien en Saltillo, Coahuila, en el marco del Festival Internacional de las Artes Julio y, finalmente llegarí a la Ciudad de México en 2019"--Page 9.

Presentación / Dra. Lidia Camacho Camacho -- Hacia y desde Los Fridos. Nuevas experiencias y nuevas historias / Luis Rius Caso -- Los Fridos. Una génesis permanente / Javier Roque Vasquez Juarez -- Lista catalográfica.

Los Fridos, was a group formed by Arturo Estrada Hernández, Arturo García Bustos, Guillermo Monroy and Fanny Rabel (Fanny Ravinovich), a group of artists that Frida Kahlo took under her wing when she was a teacher at the then School of Painting and Sculpture "La Esmeralda". The catalog includes two critical texts and color reproductions of 103 art pieces; structured in 5 thematic axes, that show the trajectory of the four disciples of Kahlo, who received the nickname "Los Fridos" for their relationship with the artist.
[textos = texts : Helena Chávez Mac Gregor, IIE-UNAM, Cuauhtémoc Medina, IIE, MUAC-UNAM, Virginia Roy Luzarraga, MUAC-UNAM ; curadores: Helena Chávez Mac Gregor y Virginia Roy Luzarraga].
MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo, UNAM,

"Published on occasion of the exhibition "Fritzia Irízar: Mazatlanica" (June 27, 2019 to January 5, 2020) MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo. UNAM, Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, Mexico City, in collaboration with TEOR/ética, San José, Costa Rica."--Facing Title Page.

Entre la alquimia y la crisálida = Between the alchemy and the chrysalis / Virginia Roy Luzarraga -- Obra comentada = Comented works / Fritizia Irízar -- Madreperla "mazatlanica": una crítica a la explotación de lo vivo = The "Mazatlanica pearl oyster": a critique of the explotation of living things / Helena Chávez Mac Gregor -- Fritizia Irízar: una ethografía = Fritizia Irízar and ethography / Cuauhtémoc Medina -- Semblanza = Biographical sketch -- Catálogo = Catalogue.

Exhibition of the latest work by the artist Fritzia Irízar (Culiacán, 1977) where she investigates the value of materials such as gold, diamonds and pearls, based on their correlation with their processes of work, exploitation and consumption. Irízar goes beyond the precious character of the "material," in a number of analogies and comparisons, and its relationship with the social status value that emerges from the tension between historical, animal and social questions.
diseño yempoderamiento femenino = I will what I want : women, design, and empowerment /
[curatorial, concept, texts and research : Jimena Acosta Romero and Michelle Millar Fisher].
Catalog of an exhibition held at the Arnold and Sheila Aronson Galleries, Parsons School of Design, New York, N.Y., April 8-23, 2017, and at the MUCA Roma, Mexico City, January 18-April 22, 2018.

"The exhibition features objects, interfaces, and clothing that have sought to enable those who have uteruses, menstruate, or embrace womanhood as independent and creative subjects in a material world largely designed by and for men but consumed by those who identify as women."--New School website (viewed on September 12, 2018)

"I Will What I Want: Women, Design, and Empowerment explores the complex and sometimes-contradictory role that design has played from the mid-Twentieth Century, through second wave feminism, to present non-binary intersections in the pursuit of gender expression and equality for those who have uteruses, menstruate, and/or identify as women."
Arnold and Sheila Aronson Galleries (Parsons School of Design),
Fabiola Torres-Alzaga y Mara Fortes Acosta.
"[Beyond the Fragile Geometry of Space]"--Title Page.
Historias de la noche -- Int. Sala de Casa Dia -- Int. Sala Casa de Isabella Tyson. Atardecer -- Un error de continuidad.

ESPAC presents the following collaboration and exhibition, which corresponds to the third title of the series: Stories of the Night, by Fabiola Torres-Alzaga and Mara Fortes Acosta, part of the dialogue between light and darkness in the cinema that extends beyond the movie, the framing or the screen. The negativeʺ space of the cinema transferred to the drawing and literary set becomes a scenario where anecdotes, reflections, dialogues and perspectives trigger new complicities between image and movement.
un proyecto de José Luis Sánchez Rull /
Realismo para la causa de una revolución futura / José Luis Sánchez Rull.

Libros/Proyecto is a series that explores the development of artistic projects within the editorial space. This number is dedicated to artist José Luis Sánchez Rull whose artistic body of work created in his home-workshop in Tláhuac (Mexico City) is inspired in music, horror and fantasy. "This is a book of proofs, the evidence that accumulated in the production process of the engraving folder KAMA SUTRA - NO PARADISES. What I show here is a concatenation of regrets or "pentimenti", the description of a struggle in the road to a finished work."--Page [1720.
farsa y artificio = farse and artifice /
[curaduría = curatorship : Tanya Baron, Alejandra Labastida ; textos = texts : José Luis Barrios, UIA [and others]].
MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo, UNAM ;

"Published on occasion of the exhibition Melanie Smith: Farse and Artifice first exhibited in the MACBA, Museu d'Art Contemporani (May 18 to October 7, 2018) and in the MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo, UNAM, Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, Mexico City; (May 26 to October 6, 2019) and the Museo Amparo, Puebla (May 26 to October 7, 2019)."--Facing Title Page.

Los síntomas de la turbulencia, o si te asomas por el vórtice veras la ciudad espiral = The symptoms of turbulence, or if you peer into the vortex you'll see the spiral city / Alejandra Labastida -- Melanie Smith: farsa y artificio. Cuando el humor perfora lo imaginario = Melanie Smith: farce and artifice. When humor pierces the imaginary / José Luis Barrios - Producir la falla. Una conversación con Melanie Smith = Producing the flaw. A conversation with Melanie Smith / Cuauhtémoc Medina -- Semblanza = Biographical Sketch -- Catálogo = Catalogue.

Since the 1980s, Melanie Smith (United Kingdom, 1965) has addressed a number of interrelated themes encompassing the effects and the detritus of industrialization, the economy and the aesthetics of abstraction, urbanization, colonialism and, more recently, nature and entropy, through a blurring and blending of the logics of the worlds of the image, cinema, and performance. The exhibition was developed by the Museu dœArt Contemporani de Barcelona (MACBA) and takes in all the media used by the artist, from her first sculptures, assemblages, relief works and paintings up to her works in video, photography and installation. The version shown at the MUAC and Museo Amparo focuses on the driving forces behind her more recent works, which have seen her experimenting with her own gaze as an artist or producer of images in terms of time-space. In her most recent creations, Smith works with distance rooted in a physical perspective, taking journeys to the Amazon jungle or the Atacama desert in Fordlandia and María Elena, as well as the anti-voyage of Skype. She also addresses this theme from a formal, technological perspective using security cameras or other mechanisms to distance her from the position of authorial control. The works shown in this exhibition appear in two cities simultaneously: Puebla and Mexico City. The project is not conceived as two parallel shows, but one single one. To achieve this sense of simultaneity, a system of crossed gazes and references between the works is employed, with peepholes that enable viewers to see live what is happening in the other venue. In this way, a dialogue is established between the two museums and between different moments in the artistic career of Melanie Smith.
futuros y posibilidades = Digital museum : future and posibilities /
[editores = editors : Mónica Amieva, Luis Vargas Santiago ; textos = texts : Jane Alexander [and others]].
MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo, UNAM,

"Published on occasion of the encounter Digital Museum. Future and Posibilities (November14 to November 16, 2017) MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo. UNAM, UniversidadNacional Autónoma de México, Mexico City."--Facing Title Page.

Presentación = Foreword / Graciela de la Torre, Nidia Chávez -- Mapas de ruta: #MuseoDigitalMX = Roadmaps: #MuseoDigitalMX / Luis Vargas -- El museo sin marco: acumulación, uso y mediación digital = The Museum without Frame: Accumulation, Use and Digital Mediation / Alberto López Cuenca -- Un caso de ansiedad: la transformación digital de los museos = A Case of Anxiety: The Digital Transformation of Museums / Javier Pantoja Ferrari -- Enseñar a los humanos a ser mejores humanos: replanteando el papel de los museos en la sociedad = Teaching Humans to be Better Humans: Reframing the Role of Museums in Society / Liz Neely -- Artlens Gallery: por qué importa la iteración = Artlens Gallery: Why Iteration Matters / Jane Alexander -- Estudios de caso = Case Studies / Gemma Argüello, Tania Candiani -- Bibliografía comentada = Commented Bibliography -- Semblanzas de los colaboradores = Collaborators Biographical Sketch.

A complete overview of the ways in which technologies in museums have served for the successful generation of creative content, digital platforms, educational processes and new forms of interaction with audiences. Nearly 40 cultural institutions, digital studios and technology consultants, from Brazil, Spain, the United States, Mexico, the Netherlands, Peru and the United Kingdom, met to share experiences and knowledge. "This book deepens and expands on the debates that took place at #MuseoDigitalMX with new data and reflections by Jane Alexander, Liz Neely and Javier Pantoja Ferrari, enriched by contributions by other colleagues who didnœt participate in the event, such as Gemma Argüello and Alberto López Cuenca, not to mention the diagrams by the artist Tania Candiani and the annotated bibliographies by contributors who, from different perspectives, map the key concepts of the digital museum. The first approach is here; we shall see what new developments and approaches the future will bring." --Page 94.
dirección editorial Isabel María Pérez Pérez ; [textos de] Rufo Caballero and others].

El expresionismo goticista de Nelson Domínguez, una violenta celebtación de la belleza / Rufo Caballero -- Exploraciones de Nelson Domínguez / David Mateo -- Y ¿por qué no? Monography dedicated to expressionist artist Nelson Domínguez (Baire, Santiago de Cuba 1947). The collection conceived as an approach to the work of Cuban plastic artists offers a concentrated information that includes reviews and essays, images of his works, photographs and a biographical selection of the creator.
Consejo Nacional de las Artes Plásticas (Cuba),

Retrospective of multifaceted sculptor Paloma Torres (Mexico City, 1960), whose artistic production is strongly related to architecture and urbanism. "An example is the textile mural "Camino a Puebla", which shows a fragment of the arial view of one of the large suburban areas on the periphery of Mexico City, which could be that of many cities that share the drama of expansion without control or planification.ʺ (HKB Translation) --Page 1.
dirección editorial Isabel María Pérez Pérez ; [textos de] Jorge de la Fuente and others].

Pedro Pablo Oliva: crónicas de lo maravilloso y otros temas / Jorge de la Fuente -- Pedro Pablo Oliva: el encanto de una pequeña hoja de tamarindol / Angel Calcines -- El juego de la vida o un mundo de pura poesía / Hortensia Montero -- Dossier de obras: años setenta -- Dossier de obras: años ochenta -- Dossier de obras: años noventa -- Dossier de obras: años dos mil -- Cronología.

"The Museo Mural Diego Rivera invites us to rediscover, with the present edition that documents the commemorative exhibition, the life and work of Rosendo Soto" (HKB Translation) --Page 7.
Published on the occasion of the exhibition held at the Museo Mural Diego Rivera in Mexico City, from August 7 to November 1, 2015.

Rosendo Soto: por derecho propio / Raúl Cano Monroy -- Murales del profesor Rosendo Soto Álvarez / Luz Elena Soto Martínez -- El paisajismo de Rosendo Soto / Alan Rojas Orzechowski -- Rosendo Soto y el diseño moderno / Juan Rafael Coronel Rivera -- Rastros de un incipiente ilustrador / Karen N. Juárez Peña -- Cronología / María Estela Duarte; Raúl Cano Monroy.

The exhibit shows the work of an artist who has been a pillar of Mexican painting is the purpose of this review that covers three pictorial stages of his development: as a student and student of Rufino Tamayo in the thirties, on allegorical themes of post-revolutionary nationalism; his stage in the forties that reveals a Mexican style with the influence of pre-Hispanic culture and realistic physiognomy in his characters, for which he opted during the decades of 1950 to 1980. it integrates 60 images of the archive that for 50 years was under the shelter of his daughter Martha. The artist exhibited individually for the only time in the Salon of Mexican Plastic in 1993 and in more than 50 exhibitions of a collective nature, but it was in 2015, thanks to the curatorship of Raúl Cano Monroy, which was held the first exhibition of the multifaceted Jalisco painter at the Diego Rivera Mural Museum. The catalog gathers more than 60 images and thanks to the facilities granted by the painter's family, the first investigation and deep approach to his work and his life achievements.
Museo Mural Diego Rivera (Mexico City, Mexico),
Antonio Bravo, Marwa Arsanios, Cristóbal Sarro, Núria Güell.
MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo, UNAM :

"Published on occasion of the exhibition "Temporal. Residency Program" (November 10 to March 31, 2019) MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo. UNAM, Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, Mexico City; (May 4 to July 8, 2019) Museo Amparo, Puebla."--Facing Title Page.

Recuperar el temporal = Recovering rainfed agriculture / Daniela Pérez -- Preguntas al pie o ¿quién cuida a los que cuidan? = Questions in the margin, or Who takes care of the caretakers? / Alejandra Labastida -- Antonio Bravo: Lecciones de trabajo = Work lessons -- Bitácora = Log / Antonio Bravo -- Las piedras de mi tía = My auntœs stones / Antonio Bravo -- Lecciones de siembra = Planting lessons / Antonio Bravo -- Lecciones de cosecha = Harvest lessons / Antonio Bravo --.

Marwa Arsanios: Amateurs, estrellas y extras o El trabajo del amorAmateurs = Stars and extras or The Labor of Love -- Salario contra el trabajo doméstico = Wages against housework / Silvia Federici -- Revolución doméstica = Domestic revolution / Grupo anónimo de Beirut = Anonymous group from Beirut -- Plataforma política por los derechos de las trabajadoras y los trabajadores del hogar en México = Political platform for the rights of domestic workers in Mexico / Sindicato Nacional de Trabajadores y Trabajadoras del Hogar --.
Cristóbal Sarro: Urna de cenizas I, II, III = Urn of Ashes I, II, III --.

Núria Güell: Una película de Dios = A godly tale -- Dios es ... God is ... / Manuel Hernández -- Interpretaciones de obra = Interpretation of paintings / Núria Güell (comp.) -- Semblanzas = Biographical Sketches -- Catálogo = Catalogue.

"Rainfed agriculture is also an indicator of a certain form of time: a time of waiting, observing, patience, and a rhythm that must adapt to whatever natural conditions might arise. The project presented here is called Temporal. Residency Program, a collaboration between the Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo (MUAC) and the Museo Amparo, exhibited at both museums in 2018 and 2019, respectively. In this project, time and human adaptation to time, as part of the processes in question, have had a decisive influence on the results, which will probably exceed the specified timeframes. Temporal began with an invitation to four artists: Marwa Arsanios (Washington, D.C., 1978), Antonio Bravo (Mexico State, 1983), Núria Güell (Vidreres, Girona, 1981), and Cristóbal Sarro (Puebla, 1992), to conduct a residency around Mexico City or Puebla to produce a new piece of work. The project organically adapted to each artist's research process, which allowed us to modify the initial deadlines in hopes of positively shaping their evolution and formal results."--Page 15.
días únicos: el estudio y su archivo = special days : the Studio and its archives /
[textos = texts : Cuauhtémoc Medina, MUAC, IIE-UNAM, Yvonne Venegas].
MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo, UNAM ;

"Published on occasion of the exhibition Yvonne Venegas. Special Days: The Studio and Its Archive (August 24 to December 1, 2019) MUAC, Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo. unam, Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, Mexico City".
The exhibition was part of the Festival Internacional de Fotografía FotoMéxico.

Archivo J. L. Venegas: entre el recuerdo oficial y los momentos vulnerables = The Archivo J.L. Venegas: Between official memories and moments of vulnerability / Yvonne Venegas -- El archivo y su sombra = The archive and Its shadow / Cuauhtémoc Medina -- Semblanza = Biographical Sketch -- Catálogo = Catalog.

The photographic project of Yvonne Venegas (Long Beach, 1970) is the result of the rescue of images from the archive of the commercial photographic studio Venegas Fotografía Fina, established by her parents José Luis and Julia Edith Venegas, in Tijuana, Baja California since 1972. The exhibition is a reflection on the methodologies of the wedding photography from his parents' studio, while analyzing the relationship between intimate photography and contemporary artistic research practice. Through the appropriation of images and through an acute analytical exercise on them, Venegas shows the routines that defined the iconography of the middle class of the border city of Tijuana during the seventies and eighties.
